result.execSummary:
The defendant Edwardo Perez Cruz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Trempealeau County Case No. 22CF43 and Trempealeau County Case No. 22CF109

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to pay court costs. Bond to be applied.
Defendant to complete AODA Assessment and all follow through.

Defendant is to complete an anger management assessment and any follow up treatment deemed appropriate. 

Defendant is to complete a domestic violence assessment and any follow up treatment deemed appropriate. 

Defendant is to comply with Domestic Violence Offender rules. 

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 

Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at the discretion of the agent for sanction purposes.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 10:07 PM- Same appearances. Joint recommendation presented to the court. Court requests more information. State makes argument. Defense makes argument. Court advised defendant of rights/max penalties. Defendant KVI waives all rights and enters NC plea to count 1. Court finds defendant G of count 1. Defendant sentenced. Count 2 is DRI.
